documentation.text:
@dev Helper function to extract a useful revert message from a failed call.
 If the returned data is malformed or not correctly abi encoded then this call can fail itself.

@notice Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`.
 Lookup `IERC20.permit`.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(contract IERC20 => struct Rebase storage ref)

documentation.text:
Modifier to check if the msg.sender is allowed to use funds belonging to the 'from' address.
 If 'from' is msg.sender, it's allowed.
 If 'from' is the BentoBox itself, it's allowed. Any ETH, token balances (above the known balances) or BentoBox balances
 can be taken by anyone.
 This is to enable skimming, not just for deposits, but also for withdrawals or transfers, enabling better composability.
 If 'from' is a clone of a masterContract AND the 'from' address has approved that masterContract, it's allowed.

params.amounts: of the tokens for each receiver.
params.borrower: The address of the contract that implements and conforms to `IBatchFlashBorrower` and handles the flashloan.
params.data: The calldata to pass to the `borrower` contract.
params.receivers: An array of the token receivers. A one-to-one mapping with `tokens` and `amounts`.

params.data: Additional abi encoded calldata that is passed to the new clone via `IMasterContract.init`.
params.masterContract: The address of the contract to clone.
params.useCreate2: Creates the clone by using the CREATE2 opcode, in this case `data` will be used as salt.

returns.cloneAddress: Address of the created clone contract.

params.amount: Token amount in native representation to deposit.
params.from: which account to pull the tokens.
params.share: Token amount represented in shares to deposit. Takes precedence over `amount`.
params.to: which account to push the tokens.

returns.shareOut: The deposited amount represented in shares.

params.borrower: The address of the contract that implements and conforms to `IFlashBorrower` and handles the flashloan.
params.data: The calldata to pass to the `borrower` contract.
params.token: The address of the token to receive.

params.balance: True if housekeeping should be done.
params.maxChangeAmount: The maximum amount for either pulling or pushing from/to the `IStrategy` contract.
params.token: The address of the token for which a strategy is deployed.

params.approved: If True approves access. If False revokes access.
params.masterContract: The address who gains or loses access.
params.user: The address of the user that approves or revokes access.

setStrategy(address,address).details: Only the owner of this contract is allowed to change this.

params.newStrategy: The address of the contract that conforms to `IStrategy`.
params.token: The address of the token that maps to a strategy to change.

setStrategyTargetPercentage(address,uint.details: Only the owner of this contract is allowed to change this.

params.targetPercentage_: The new target in percent. Must be lesser or equal to `MAX_TARGET_PERCENTAGE`.
params.token: The address of the token that maps to a strategy to change.

toAmount(address,uint256,bool).details: Helper function represent shares back into the `token` amount.

params.roundUp: If the result should be rounded up.

returns.amount: The share amount back into native representation.

toShare(address,uint256,bool).details: Helper function to represent an `amount` of `token` in shares.

params.roundUp: If the result `share` should be rounded up.

returns.share: The token amount represented in shares.

params.from: which user to pull the tokens.
params.to: which user to push the tokens.

params.from: which user to pull the tokens.
params.shares: The amount of `token` in shares for each receiver in `tos`.

params.direct: True if `newOwner` should be set immediately. False if `newOwner` needs to use `claimOwnership`.
params.renounce: Allows the `newOwner` to be `address(0)` if `direct` and `renounce` is True. Has no effect otherwise.

params.amount: of tokens. Either one of `amount` or `share` needs to be supplied.

params.share: Like above, but `share` takes precedence over `amount`.
params.to: which user to push the tokens.

All rights reserved\r\n// Twitter: @Boring_Crypto\r\n\r\n// Special thanks to Keno for all his hard work and support\r\n\r\n// Version 22-Mar-2021\r\n\r\npragma solidity 0.6.12;\r\npragma experimental ABIEncoderV2;\r\n\r\n// solhint-disable avoid-low-level-calls\r\n// solhint-disable not-rely-on-time\r\n// solhint-disable no-inline-assembly\r\n\r\n// File @boringcrypto/boring-solidity/contracts/interfaces/IERC20.sol@v1.2.0\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\ninterface IERC20 {\r\n    function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256);\r\n\r\n    function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256);\r\n\r\n    function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint256);\r\n\r\n    function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);\r\n\r\n    event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value);\r\n    event Approval(address indexed owner, address indexed spender, uint256 value);\r\n\r\n    /// @notice EIP 2612\r\n    function permit(\r\n        address owner,\r\n        address spender,\r\n        uint256 value,\r\n        uint256 deadline,\r\n        uint8 v,\r\n        bytes32 r,\r\n        bytes32 s\r\n    ) external;\r\n\r\n    function decimals() external view returns (uint256);\r\n}\r\n\r\n// File contracts/interfaces/IFlashLoan.sol\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\ninterface IFlashBorrower {\r\n    /// @notice The flashloan callback. `amount` + `fee` needs to repayed to msg.sender before this call returns.\r\n    /// @param sender The address of the invoker of this flashloan.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the token that is loaned.\r\n    /// @param amount of the `token` that is loaned.\r\n    /// @param fee The fee that needs to be paid on top for this loan. Needs to be the same as `token`.\r\n    /// @param data Additional data that was passed to the flashloan function.\r\n    function onFlashLoan(\r\n        address sender,\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        uint256 fee,\r\n        bytes calldata data\r\n    ) external;\r\n}\r\n\r\ninterface IBatchFlashBorrower {\r\n    /// @notice The callback for batched flashloans. Every amount + fee needs to repayed to msg.sender before this call returns.\r\n    /// @param sender The address of the invoker of this flashloan.\r\n    /// @param tokens Array of addresses for ERC-20 tokens that is loaned.\r\n    /// @param amounts A one-to-one map to `tokens` that is loaned.\r\n    /// @param fees A one-to-one map to `tokens` that needs to be paid on top for each loan. Needs to be the same token.\r\n    /// @param data Additional data that was passed to the flashloan function.\r\n    function onBatchFlashLoan(\r\n        address sender,\r\n        IERC20[] calldata tokens,\r\n        uint256[] calldata amounts,\r\n        uint256[] calldata fees,\r\n        bytes calldata data\r\n    ) external;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// File contracts/interfaces/IWETH.sol\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\ninterface IWETH {\r\n    function deposit() external payable;\r\n\r\n    function withdraw(uint256) external;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// File contracts/interfaces/IStrategy.sol\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\ninterface IStrategy {\r\n    /// @notice Send the assets to the Strategy and call skim to invest them.\r\n    /// @param amount The amount of tokens to invest.\r\n    function skim(uint256 amount) external;\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Harvest any profits made converted to the asset and pass them to the caller.\r\n    /// @param balance The amount of tokens the caller thinks it has invested.\r\n    /// @param sender The address of the initiator of this transaction. Can be used for reimbursements, etc.\r\n    /// @return amountAdded The delta (+profit or -loss) that occured in contrast to `balance`.\r\n    function harvest(uint256 balance, address sender) external returns (int256 amountAdded);\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Withdraw assets. The returned amount can differ from the requested amount due to rounding.\r\n    /// @dev The `actualAmount` should be very close to the amount.\r\n    /// The difference should NOT be used to report a loss. That's what harvest is for.\r\n    /// @param amount The requested amount the caller wants to withdraw.\r\n    /// @return actualAmount The real amount that is withdrawn.\r\n    function withdraw(uint256 amount) external returns (uint256 actualAmount);\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Withdraw all assets in the safest way possible. This shouldn't fail.\r\n    /// @param balance The amount of tokens the caller thinks it has invested.\r\n    /// @return amountAdded The delta (+profit or -loss) that occured in contrast to `balance`.\r\n    function exit(uint256 balance) external returns (int256 amountAdded);\r\n}\r\n\r\n// File @boringcrypto/boring-solidity/contracts/libraries/BoringERC20.sol@v1.2.0\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\nlibrary BoringERC20 {\r\n    bytes4 private constant SIG_SYMBOL = 0x95d89b41; // symbol()\r\n    bytes4 private constant SIG_NAME = 0x06fdde03; // name()\r\n    bytes4 private constant SIG_DECIMALS = 0x313ce567; // decimals()\r\n    bytes4 private constant SIG_TRANSFER = 0xa9059cbb; // transfer(address,uint256)\r\n    bytes4 private constant SIG_TRANSFER_FROM = 0x23b872dd; // transferFrom(address,address,uint256)\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Provides a safe ERC20.transfer version for different ERC-20 implementations.\r\n    /// Reverts on a failed transfer.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the ERC-20 token.\r\n    /// @param to Transfer tokens to.\r\n    /// @param amount The token amount.\r\n    function safeTransfer(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint256 amount\r\n    ) internal {\r\n        (bool success, bytes memory data) = address(token).call(abi.encodeWithSelector(SIG_TRANSFER, to, amount));\r\n        require(success && (data.length == 0 || abi.decode(data, (bool))), \"BoringERC20: Transfer failed\");\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Provides a safe ERC20.transferFrom version for different ERC-20 implementations.\r\n    /// Reverts on a failed transfer.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the ERC-20 token.\r\n    /// @param from Transfer tokens from.\r\n    /// @param to Transfer tokens to.\r\n    /// @param amount The token amount.\r\n    function safeTransferFrom(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        address from,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint256 amount\r\n    ) internal {\r\n        (bool success, bytes memory data) = address(token).call(abi.encodeWithSelector(SIG_TRANSFER_FROM, from, to, amount));\r\n        require(success && (data.length == 0 || abi.decode(data, (bool))), \"BoringERC20: TransferFrom failed\");\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n// File @boringcrypto/boring-solidity/contracts/libraries/BoringMath.sol@v1.2.0\r\n// License-Identifier: MIT\r\n\r\n/// @notice A library for performing overflow-/underflow-safe math,\r\n/// updated with awesomeness from of DappHub (https://github.com/dapphub/ds-math).\r\nlibrary BoringMath {\r\n    function add(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256 c) {\r\n        require((c = a + b) >= b, \"BoringMath: Add Overflow\");\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function sub(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256 c) {\r\n        require((c = a - b) <= a, \"BoringMath: Underflow\");\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function mul(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256 c) {\r\n        require(b == 0 || (c = a * b) / b == a, \"BoringMath: Mul Overflow\");\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function to128(uint256 a) internal pure returns (uint128 c) {\r\n        require(a <= uint128(-1), \"BoringMath: uint128 Overflow\");\r\n        c = uint128(a);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function to64(uint256 a) internal pure returns (uint64 c) {\r\n        require(a <= uint64(-1), \"BoringMath: uint64 Overflow\");\r\n        c = uint64(a);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function to32(uint256 a) internal pure returns (uint32 c) {\r\n        require(a <= uint32(-1), \"BoringMath: uint32 Overflow\");\r\n        c = uint32(a);\r\n }\r\n        _;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // ************************** //\r\n    // *** INTERNAL FUNCTIONS *** //\r\n    // ************************** //\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Returns the total balance of `token` this contracts holds,\r\n    /// plus the total amount this contract thinks the strategy holds.\r\n    function _tokenBalanceOf(IERC20 token) internal view returns (uint256 amount) {\r\n        amount = token.balanceOf(address(this)).add(strategyData[token].balance);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // ************************ //\r\n    // *** PUBLIC FUNCTIONS *** //\r\n    // ************************ //\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Helper function to represent an `amount` of `token` in shares.\r\n    /// @param token The ERC-20 token.\r\n    /// @param amount The `token` amount.\r\n    /// @param roundUp If the result `share` should be rounded up.\r\n    /// @return share The token amount represented in shares.\r\n    function toShare(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        bool roundUp\r\n    ) external view returns (uint256 share) {\r\n        share = totals[token].toBase(amount, roundUp);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Helper function represent shares back into the `token` amount.\r\n    /// @param token The ERC-20 token.\r\n    /// @param share The amount of shares.\r\n    /// @param roundUp If the result should be rounded up.\r\n    /// @return amount The share amount back into native representation.\r\n    function toAmount(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        uint256 share,\r\n        bool roundUp\r\n    ) external view returns (uint256 amount) {\r\n        amount = totals[token].toElastic(share, roundUp);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Deposit an amount of `token` represented in either `amount` or `share`.\r\n    /// @param token_ The ERC-20 token to deposit.\r\n    /// @param from which account to pull the tokens.\r\n    /// @param to which account to push the tokens.\r\n    /// @param amount Token amount in native representation to deposit.\r\n    /// @param share Token amount represented in shares to deposit. Takes precedence over `amount`.\r\n    /// @return amountOut The amount deposited.\r\n    /// @return shareOut The deposited amount represented in shares.\r\n    function deposit(\r\n        IERC20 token_,\r\n        address from,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        uint256 share\r\n    ) public payable allowed(from) returns (uint256 amountOut, uint256 shareOut) {\r\n        // Checks\r\n        require(to != address(0), \"BentoBox: to not set\"); // To avoid a bad UI from burning funds\r\n\r\n        // Effects\r\n        IERC20 token = token_ == USE_ETHEREUM ? wethToken : token_;\r\n        Rebase memory total = totals[token];\r\n\r\n        // If a new token gets added, the tokenSupply call checks that this is a deployed contract. Needed for security.\r\n        require(total.elastic != 0 || token.totalSupply() > 0, \"BentoBox: No tokens\");\r\n        if (share == 0) {\r\n            // value of the share may be lower than the amount due to rounding, that's ok\r\n            share = total.toBase(amount, false);\r\n            // Any deposit should lead to at least the minimum share balance, otherwise it's ignored (no amount taken)\r\n            if (total.base.add(share.to128()) < MINIMUM_SHARE_BALANCE) {\r\n                return (0, 0);\r\n            }\r\n        } else {\r\n            // amount may be lower than the value of share due to rounding, in that case, add 1 to amount (Always round up)\r\n            amount = total.toElastic(share, true);\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // In case of skimming, check that only the skimmable amount is taken.\r\n        // For ETH, the full balance is available, so no need to check.\r\n        // During flashloans the _tokenBalanceOf is lower than 'reality', so skimming deposits will mostly fail during a flashloan.\r\n        require(\r\n            from != address(this) || token_ == USE_ETHEREUM || amount <= _tokenBalanceOf(token).sub(total.elastic),\r\n            \"BentoBox: Skim too much\"\r\n        );\r\n\r\n        balanceOf[token][to] = balanceOf[token][to].add(share);\r\n        total.base = total.base.add(share.to128());\r\n        total.elastic = total.elastic.add(amount.to128());\r\n        totals[token] = total;\r\n\r\n        // Interactions\r\n        // During the first deposit, we check that this token is 'real'\r\n        if (token_ == USE_ETHEREUM) {\r\n            // X2 - If there is an error, could it cause a DoS. Like balanceOf causing revert. (SWC-113)\r\n            // X2: If the WETH implementation is faulty or malicious, it will block adding ETH (but we know the WETH implementation)\r\n            IWETH(address(wethToken)).deposit{value: amount}();\r\n        } else if (from != address(this)) {\r\n            // X2 - If there is an error, could it cause a DoS. Like balanceOf causing revert. (SWC-113)\r\n            // X2: If the token implementation is faulty or malicious, it may block adding tokens. Good.\r\n            token.safeTransferFrom(from, address(this), amount);\r\n        }\r\n        emit LogDeposit(token, from, to, amount, share);\r\n        amountOut = amount;\r\n        shareOut = share;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Withdraws an amount of `token` from a user account.\r\n    /// @param token_ The ERC-20 token to withdraw.\r\n    /// @param from which user to pull the tokens.\r\n    /// @param to which user to push the tokens.\r\n    /// @param amount of tokens. Either one of `amount` or `share` needs to be supplied.\r\n    /// @param share Like above, but `share` takes precedence over `amount`.\r\n    function withdraw(\r\n        IERC20 token_,\r\n        address from,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        uint256 share\r\n    ) public allowed(from) returns (uint256 amountOut, uint256 shareOut) {\r\n        // Checks\r\n        require(to != address(0), \"BentoBox: to not set\"); // To avoid a bad UI from burning funds\r\n\r\n        // Effects\r\n        IERC20 token = token_ == USE_ETHEREUM ? wethToken : token_;\r\n        Rebase memory total = totals[token];\r\n        if (share == 0) {\r\n            // value of the share paid could be lower than the amount paid due to rounding, in that case, add a share (Always round up)\r\n            share = total.toBase(amount, true);\r\n        } else {\r\n            // amount may be lower than the value of share due to rounding, that's ok\r\n            amount = total.toElastic(share, false);\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        balanceOf[token][from] = balanceOf[token][from].sub(share);\r\n        total.elastic = total.elastic.sub(amount.to128());\r\n        total.base = total.base.sub(share.to128());\r\n        // There have to be at least 1000 shares left to prevent reseting the share/amount ratio (unless it's fully emptied)\r\n        require(total.base >= MINIMUM_SHARE_BALANCE || total.base == 0, \"BentoBox: cannot empty\");\r\n        totals[token] = total;\r\n\r\n        // Interactions\r\n        if (token_ == USE_ETHEREUM) {\r\n            // X2, X3: A revert or big gas usage in the WETH contract could block withdrawals, but WETH9 is fine.\r\n            IWETH(address(wethToken)).withdraw(amount);\r\n            // X2, X3: A revert or big gas usage could block, however, the to address is under control of the caller.\r\n            (bool success, ) = to.call{value: amount}(\"\");\r\n            require(success, \"BentoBox: ETH transfer failed\");\r\n        } else {\r\n            // X2, X3: A malicious token could block withdrawal of just THAT token.\r\n            //         masterContracts may want to take care not to rely on withdraw always succeeding.\r\n            token.safeTransfer(to, amount);\r\n        }\r\n        emit LogWithdraw(token, from, to, amount, share);\r\n        amountOut = amount;\r\n        shareOut = share;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Transfer shares from a user account to another one.\r\n    /// @param token The ERC-20 token to transfer.\r\n    /// @param from which user to pull the tokens.\r\n    /// @param to which user to push the tokens.\r\n    /// @param share The amount of `token` in shares.\r\n    // Clones of master contracts can transfer from any account that has approved them\r\n    // F3 - Can it be combined with another similar function?\r\n    // F3: This isn't combined with transferMultiple for gas optimization\r\n    function transfer(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        address from,\r\n        address to,\r\n        uint256 share\r\n    ) public allowed(from) {\r\n        // Checks\r\n        require(to != address(0), \"BentoBox: to not set\"); // To avoid a bad UI from burning funds\r\n\r\n        // Effects\r\n        balanceOf[token][from] = balanceOf[token][from].sub(share);\r\n        balanceOf[token][to] = balanceOf[token][to].add(share);\r\n\r\n        emit LogTransfer(token, from, to, share);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Transfer shares from a user account to multiple other ones.\r\n    /// @param token The ERC-20 token to transfer.\r\n    /// @param from which user to pull the tokens.\r\n    /// @param tos The receivers of the tokens.\r\n    /// @param shares The amount of `token` in shares for each receiver in `tos`.\r\n    // F3 - Can it be combined with another similar function?\r\n    // F3: This isn't combined with transfer for gas optimization\r\n    function transferMultiple(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        address from,\r\n        address[] calldata tos,\r\n        uint256[] calldata shares\r\n    ) public allowed(from) {\r\n        // Checks\r\n        require(tos[0] != address(0), \"BentoBox: to[0] not set\"); // To avoid a bad UI from burning funds\r\n\r\n        // Effects\r\n        uint256 totalAmount;\r\n        uint256 len = tos.length;\r\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < len; i++) {\r\n            address to = tos[i];\r\n            balanceOf[token][to] = balanceOf[token][to].add(shares[i]);\r\n            totalAmount = totalAmount.add(shares[i]);\r\n            emit LogTransfer(token, from, to, shares[i]);\r\n        }\r\n        balanceOf[token][from] = balanceOf[token][from].sub(totalAmount);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Flashloan ability.\r\n    /// @param borrower The address of the contract that implements and conforms to `IFlashBorrower` and handles the flashloan.\r\n    /// @param receiver Address of the token receiver.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the token to receive.\r\n    /// @param amount of the tokens to receive.\r\n    /// @param data The calldata to pass to the `borrower` contract.\r\n    // F5 - Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern followed? (SWC-107)\r\n    // F5: Not possible to follow this here, reentrancy has been reviewed\r\n    // F6 - Check for front-running possibilities, such as the approve function (SWC-114)\r\n    // F6: Slight grieving possible by withdrawing an amount before someone tries to flashloan close to the full amount.\r\n    function flashLoan(\r\n        IFlashBorrower borrower,\r\n        address receiver,\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        bytes calldata data\r\n    ) public {\r\n        uint256 fee = amount.mul(FLASH_LOAN_FEE) / FLASH_LOAN_FEE_PRECISION;\r\n        token.safeTransfer(receiver, amount);\r\n\r\n        borrower.onFlashLoan(msg.sender, token, amount, fee, data);\r\n\r\n        require(_tokenBalanceOf(token) >= totals[token].addElastic(fee.to128()), \"BentoBox: Wrong amount\");\r\n        emit LogFlashLoan(address(borrower), token, amount, fee, receiver);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Support for batched flashloans. Useful to request multiple different `tokens` in a single transaction.\r\n    /// @param borrower The address of the contract that implements and conforms to `IBatchFlashBorrower` and handles the flashloan.\r\n    /// @param receivers An array of the token receivers. A one-to-one mapping with `tokens` and `amounts`.\r\n    /// @param tokens The addresses of the tokens.\r\n    /// @param amounts of the tokens for each receiver.\r\n    /// @param data The calldata to pass to the `borrower` contract.\r\n    // F5 - Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern followed? (SWC-107)\r\n    // F5: Not possible to follow this here, reentrancy has been reviewed\r\n    // F6 - Check for front-running possibilities, such as the approve function (SWC-114)\r\n    // F6: Slight grieving possible by withdrawing an amount before someone tries to flashloan close to the full amount.\r\n    function batchFlashLoan(\r\n        IBatchFlashBorrower borrower,\r\n        address[] calldata receivers,\r\n        IERC20[] calldata tokens,\r\n        uint256[] calldata amounts,\r\n        bytes calldata data\r\n    ) public {\r\n        uint256[] memory fees = new uint256[](tokens.length);\r\n\r\n        uint256 len = tokens.length;\r\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < len; i++) {\r\n            uint256 amount = amounts[i];\r\n            fees[i] = amount.mul(FLASH_LOAN_FEE) / FLASH_LOAN_FEE_PRECISION;\r\n\r\n            tokens[i].safeTransfer(receivers[i], amounts[i]);\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        borrower.onBatchFlashLoan(msg.sender, tokens, amounts, fees, data);\r\n\r\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < len; i++) {\r\n            IERC20 token = tokens[i];\r\n            require(_tokenBalanceOf(token) >= totals[token].addElastic(fees[i].to128()), \"BentoBox: Wrong amount\");\r\n            emit LogFlashLoan(address(borrower), token, amounts[i], fees[i], receivers[i]);\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Sets the target percentage of the strategy for `token`.\r\n    /// @dev Only the owner of this contract is allowed to change this.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the token that maps to a strategy to change.\r\n    /// @param targetPercentage_ The new target in percent. Must be lesser or equal to `MAX_TARGET_PERCENTAGE`.\r\n    function setStrategyTargetPercentage(IERC20 token, uint64 targetPercentage_) public onlyOwner {\r\n        // Checks\r\n        require(targetPercentage_ <= MAX_TARGET_PERCENTAGE, \"StrategyManager: Target too high\");\r\n\r\n        // Effects\r\n        strategyData[token].targetPercentage = targetPercentage_;\r\n        emit LogStrategyTargetPercentage(token, targetPercentage_);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Sets the contract address of a new strategy that conforms to `IStrategy` for `token`.\r\n    /// Must be called twice with the same arguments.\r\n    /// A new strategy becomes pending first and can be activated once `STRATEGY_DELAY` is over.\r\n    /// @dev Only the owner of this contract is allowed to change this.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the token that maps to a strategy to change.\r\n    /// @param newStrategy The address of the contract that conforms to `IStrategy`.\r\n    // F5 - Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern followed? (SWC-107)\r\n    // F5: Total amount is updated AFTER interaction. But strategy is under our control.\r\n    // C4 - Use block.timestamp only for long intervals (SWC-116)\r\n    // C4: block.timestamp is used for a period of 2 weeks, which is long enough\r\n    function setStrategy(IERC20 token, IStrategy newStrategy) public onlyOwner {\r\n        StrategyData memory data = strategyData[token];\r\n        IStrategy pending = pendingStrategy[token];\r\n        if (data.strategyStartDate == 0 || pending != newStrategy) {\r\n            pendingStrategy[token] = newStrategy;\r\n            // C1 - All math done through BoringMath (SWC-101)\r\n            // C1: Our sun will swallow the earth well before this overflows\r\n            data.strategyStartDate = (block.timestamp + STRATEGY_DELAY).to64();\r\n            emit LogStrategyQueued(token, newStrategy);\r\n        } else {\r\n            require(data.strategyStartDate != 0 && block.timestamp >= data.strategyStartDate, \"StrategyManager: Too early\");\r\n            if (address(strategy[token]) != address(0)) {\r\n                int256 balanceChange = strategy[token].exit(data.balance);\r\n                // Effects\r\n                if (balanceChange > 0) {\r\n                    uint256 add = uint256(balanceChange);\r\n                    totals[token].addElastic(add);\r\n                    emit LogStrategyProfit(token, add);\r\n                } else if (balanceChange < 0) {\r\n                    uint256 sub = uint256(-balanceChange);\r\n                    totals[token].subElastic(sub);\r\n                    emit LogStrategyLoss(token, sub);\r\n                }\r\n\r\n                emit LogStrategyDivest(token, data.balance);\r\n            }\r\n            strategy[token] = pending;\r\n            data.strategyStartDate = 0;\r\n            data.balance = 0;\r\n            pendingStrategy[token] = IStrategy(0);\r\n            emit LogStrategySet(token, newStrategy);\r\n        }\r\n        strategyData[token] = data;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice The actual process of yield farming. Executes the strategy of `token`.\r\n    /// Optionally does housekeeping if `balance` is true.\r\n    /// `maxChangeAmount` is relevant for skimming or withdrawing if `balance` is true.\r\n    /// @param token The address of the token for which a strategy is deployed.\r\n    /// @param balance True if housekeeping should be done.\r\n    /// @param maxChangeAmount The maximum amount for either pulling or pushing from/to the `IStrategy` contract.\r\n    // F5 - Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern followed? (SWC-107)\r\n    // F5: Total amount is updated AFTER interaction. But strategy is under our control.\r\n    // F5: Not followed to prevent reentrancy issues with flashloans and BentoBox skims?\r\n    function harvest(\r\n        IERC20 token,\r\n        bool balance,\r\n        uint256 maxChangeAmount\r\n    ) public {\r\n        StrategyData memory data = strategyData[token];\r\n        IStrategy _strategy = strategy[token];\r\n        int256 balanceChange = _strategy.harvest(data.balance, msg.sender);\r\n        if (balanceChange == 0 && !balance) {\r\n            return;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        uint256 totalElastic = totals[token].elastic;\r\n\r\n        if (balanceChange > 0) {\r\n            uint256 add = uint256(balanceChange);\r\n            totalElastic = totalElastic.add(add);\r\n            totals[token].elastic = totalElastic.to128();\r\n            emit LogStrategyProfit(token, add);\r\n        } else if (balanceChange < 0) {\r\n            // C1 - All math done through BoringMath (SWC-101)\r\n            // C1: balanceChange could overflow if it's max negative int128.\r\n            // But tokens with balances that large are not supported by the BentoBox.\r\n            uint256 sub = uint256(-balanceChange);\r\n            totalElastic = totalElastic.sub(sub);\r\n            totals[token].elastic = totalElastic.to128();\r\n            data.balance = data.balance.sub(sub.to128());\r\n            emit LogStrategyLoss(token, sub);\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        if (balance) {\r\n            uint256 targetBalance = totalElastic.mul(data.targetPercentage) / 100;\r\n            // if data.balance == targetBalance there is nothing to update\r\n            if (data.balance < targetBalance) {\r\n                uint256 amountOut = targetBalance.sub(data.balance);\r\n                if (maxChangeAmount != 0 && amountOut > maxChangeAmount) {\r\n                    amountOut = maxChangeAmount;\r\n                }\r\n                token.safeTransfer(address(_strategy), amountOut);\r\n                data.balance = data.balance.add(amountOut.to128());\r\n                _strategy.skim(amountOut);\r\n                emit LogStrategyInvest(token, amountOut);\r\n            } else if (data.balance > targetBalance) {\r\n                uint256 amountIn = data.balance.sub(targetBalance.to128());\r\n                if (maxChangeAmount != 0 && amountIn > maxChangeAmount) {\r\n                    amountIn = maxChangeAmount;\r\n                }\r\n\r\n                uint256 actualAmountIn = _strategy.withdraw(amountIn);\r\n\r\n                data.balance = data.balance.sub(actualAmountIn.to128());\r\n                emit LogStrategyDivest(token, actualAmountIn);\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        strategyData[token] = data;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // Contract should be able to receive ETH deposits to support deposit & skim\r\n    // solhint-disable-next-line no-empty-blocks\r\n    receive() external payable {}\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0xb368ae7084d581b43e8d0c1972f3a9674968e00f107c076a036da6ccb0c155fc","license":"UNLICENSED"}},"version":1}

batch(bytes[],bool).notice: Allows batched call to self (this contract).

batchFlashLoan(address,address[],address.notice: Support for batched flashloans. Useful to request multiple different `tokens` in a single transaction.

claimOwnership().notice: Needs to be called by `pendingOwner` to claim ownership.

deploy(address,bytes,bool).notice: Deploys a given master Contract as a clone. Any ETH transferred with this call is forwarded to the new clone. Emits `LogDeploy`.

deposit(address,address,address,uint256,.notice: Deposit an amount of `token` represented in either `amount` or `share`.

harvest(address,bool,uint256).notice: The actual process of yield farming. Executes the strategy of `token`. Optionally does housekeeping if `balance` is true. `maxChangeAmount` is relevant for skimming or withdrawing if `balance` is true.

masterContractApproved(address,address).notice: masterContract to user to approval state

masterContractOf(address).notice: Mapping from clone contracts to their masterContract.

permitToken(address,address,address,uint.notice: Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. Lookup `IERC20.permit`.

registerProtocol().notice: Other contracts need to register with this master contract so that users can approve them for the BentoBox.

setMasterContractApproval(address,addres.notice: Approves or revokes a `masterContract` access to `user` funds.

setStrategy(address,address).notice: Sets the contract address of a new strategy that conforms to `IStrategy` for `token`. Must be called twice with the same arguments. A new strategy becomes pending first and can be activated once `STRATEGY_DELAY` is over.

setStrategyTargetPercentage(address,uint.notice: Sets the target percentage of the strategy for `token`.

transfer(address,address,address,uint256.notice: Transfer shares from a user account to another one.

transferMultiple(address,address,address.notice: Transfer shares from a user account to multiple other ones.

transferOwnership(address,bool,bool).notice: Transfers ownership to `newOwner`. Either directly or claimable by the new pending owner. Can only be invoked by the current `owner`.

whitelistMasterContract(address,bool).notice: Enables or disables a contract for approval without signed message.

whitelistedMasterContracts(address).notice: masterContract to whitelisted state for approval without signed message

withdraw(address,address,address,uint256.notice: Withdraws an amount of `token` from a user account.

userdoc.notice: The BentoBox is a vault for tokens. The stored tokens can be flash loaned and used in strategies. Yield from this will go to the token depositors. Rebasing tokens ARE NOT supported and WILL cause loss of funds. Any funds transfered directly onto the BentoBox will be lost, use the deposit function instead.

params.calls: An array of inputs for each call.
params.revertOnFail: If True then reverts after a failed call and stops doing further calls.

returns.results: An array with the returned data of each function call, mapped one-to-one to `calls`.
returns.successes: An array indicating the success of a call, mapped one-to-one to `calls`.

params.data: Additional abi encoded calldata that is passed to the new clone via `IMasterContract.init`.
params.masterContract: The address of the contract to clone.
params.useCreate2: Creates the clone by using the CREATE2 opcode, in this case `data` will be used as salt.

returns.cloneAddress: Address of the created clone contract.

deploy(address,bytes,bool).notice: Deploys a given master Contract as a clone. Any ETH transferred with this call is forwarded to the new clone. Emits `LogDeploy`.

masterContractOf(address).notice: Mapping from clone contracts to their masterContract.

claimOwnership().notice: Needs to be called by `pendingOwner` to claim ownership.

transferOwnership(address,bool,bool).notice: Transfers ownership to `newOwner`. Either directly or claimable by the new pending owner. Can only be invoked by the current `owner`.

params.amounts: A one-to-one map to `tokens` that is loaned.
params.data: Additional data that was passed to the flashloan function.
params.fees: A one-to-one map to `tokens` that needs to be paid on top for each loan. Needs to be the same token.
params.sender: The address of the invoker of this flashloan.
params.tokens: Array of addresses for ERC-20 tokens that is loaned.

onBatchFlashLoan(address,address[],uint2.notice: The callback for batched flashloans. Every amount + fee needs to repayed to msg.sender before this call returns.

params.data: Additional data that was passed to the flashloan function.
params.fee: The fee that needs to be paid on top for this loan. Needs to be the same as `token`.
params.sender: The address of the invoker of this flashloan.
params.token: The address of the token that is loaned.

onFlashLoan(address,address,uint256,uint.notice: The flashloan callback. `amount` + `fee` needs to repayed to msg.sender before this call returns.

params.data: Can be abi encoded arguments or anything else.

init(bytes).notice: Init function that gets called from `BoringFactory.deploy`. Also kown as the constructor for cloned contracts. Any ETH send to `BoringFactory.deploy` ends up here.

params.balance: The amount of tokens the caller thinks it has invested.

returns.amountAdded: The delta (+profit or -loss) that occured in contrast to `balance`.

params.balance: The amount of tokens the caller thinks it has invested.
params.sender: The address of the initiator of this transaction. Can be used for reimbursements, etc.

returns.amountAdded: The delta (+profit or -loss) that occured in contrast to `balance`.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to invest.

withdraw(uint256).details: The `actualAmount` should be very close to the amount. The difference should NOT be used to report a loss. That's what harvest is for.

params.amount: The requested amount the caller wants to withdraw.

returns.actualAmount: The real amount that is withdrawn.

exit(uint256).notice: Withdraw all assets in the safest way possible. This shouldn't fail.

harvest(uint256,address).notice: Harvest any profits made converted to the asset and pass them to the caller.

skim(uint256).notice: Send the assets to the Strategy and call skim to invest them.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Withdraw assets. The returned amount can differ from the requested amount due to rounding.

params.data: Additional abi encoded calldata that is passed to the new clone via `IMasterContract.init`.
params.masterContract: The address of the contract to clone.
params.useCreate2: Creates the clone by using the CREATE2 opcode, in this case `data` will be used as salt.

returns.cloneAddress: Address of the created clone contract.

params.approved: If True approves access. If False revokes access.
params.masterContract: The address who gains or loses access.
params.user: The address of the user that approves or revokes access.

params.direct: True if `newOwner` should be set immediately. False if `newOwner` needs to use `claimOwnership`.
params.renounce: Allows the `newOwner` to be `address(0)` if `direct` and `renounce` is True. Has no effect otherwise.

claimOwnership().notice: Needs to be called by `pendingOwner` to claim ownership.

deploy(address,bytes,bool).notice: Deploys a given master Contract as a clone. Any ETH transferred with this call is forwarded to the new clone. Emits `LogDeploy`.

masterContractApproved(address,address).notice: masterContract to user to approval state

masterContractOf(address).notice: Mapping from clone contracts to their masterContract.

registerProtocol().notice: Other contracts need to register with this master contract so that users can approve them for the BentoBox.

setMasterContractApproval(address,addres.notice: Approves or revokes a `masterContract` access to `user` funds.

transferOwnership(address,bool,bool).notice: Transfers ownership to `newOwner`. Either directly or claimable by the new pending owner. Can only be invoked by the current `owner`.

whitelistMasterContract(address,bool).notice: Enables or disables a contract for approval without signed message.

whitelistedMasterContracts(address).notice: masterContract to whitelisted state for approval without signed message
